name: Fareeha Almas
about: I work at the intersection of quantum/accelerator physics and machine learning. My recent work includes differentiable modeling of beam position monitors (BPMs), Bayesian experimental design with Fisher information, and open-source contributions to accelerator beam dynamics toolchains.

education.details: Thesis with UQ–ANSTO on differentiable BPM modeling & Bayesian experimental design

education.degree: B.Tech. in Electrical & Electronics Engineering (Minor in Physics)
education.institution: Kakatiya Institute of Technology and Science, Warangal

bullets: Qudits@UQ: Simulated/fabricated efficient grating couplers using FDTD (Lumerical, Tidy3D).

experience.org: Quantum Ecosystems Technology Council of India (QETCI)
bullets: Coordinated programs for training, incubation and investment in Quantum.
Designed membership services and community outreach for diverse demographics.
Led engagement for events incl. Quantum Science & Technology Hackathon 2022 (1600+ participants, 50+ mentors).
Wrote science communication articles (e.g., Quantum ML, Clifford gates).

experience.role: Education Curriculum Disruptor Fellow; Marketing & Innovation Team Lead; MarComm Group Lead
bullets: Developed Physics/Math curricula using DeepTech content engines.
Drove zero-to-one innovations grounded in Socratic learning and MBO principles.
Analyzed quantum-technology impact areas with STECH‑IMPACT framework; authored reports with ethics lens.

publications.title: Demonstrating a Fisher Information based method for optimizing BPM placements in AS2
publications.authors: Fareeha Almas, Tessa Charles, Frank Zhang, Benjamin Pope
publications.venue: Submitted to International Particle Accelerator Conference (IPAC) 2025

projects.title: Differentiable BPM Modeling & Optimal Placement (UQ–ANSTO Masters)
projects.summary: End‑to‑end differentiable BPM model with Fisher‑information‑driven placement for AS2; contributions to Cheetah (sextupoles).

projects.title: Entanglement Purification under Depolarising/Pauli Noise
projects.summary: Simulation of purification circuits; collaboration with Dr. Matthew Winnel.

projects.title: UAV Stability via Root‑Locus Control
projects.summary: Modeled civil UAV stability derivatives and demonstrated root‑locus based control using real‑time transfer functions via FOMCON & DATCOM.
